name: BD+20 2457
scenarioDescription:
The BD+20 2457 Exoplanetary System


Overview

BD+20 2457 is a star with 10.83 times the mass of the Sun, and 71.02 times its radius. It is located 5449.58 light years away from the solar system.

BD+20 2457 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the BD+20 2457 system


BD+20 2457 b

BD+20 2457 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of BD+20 2457 b is 17677.620000000003 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, BD+20 2457 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


BD+20 2457 c

BD+20 2457 c was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of BD+20 2457 c is 3965.46 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, BD+20 2457 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system BD+20 2457, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by McDonald Observatory.
